fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e3.equipments.heater

Interface HeaterSensorDataCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataOfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataRequiredCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI

    public interface HeaterSensorDataCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataOfferedCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.DataRequiredCI
    The component data interface HeaterSensorCI declares the pull and the push interfaces to get and receive sensor data from the heater component.

    Description

    BCM4Java data oriented interfaces provide means to communicate between components to exchange data rather than calling services. To achieve this, the standard BCM4Java DataOfferedCI and DataRequiredCI defines two protocols for the exchange of data: a pull protocol and a push protocol. These interfaces assume that the data exchanges are performed between a component that produces data, the producer, and another component that consumes them, the consumer.

    In the standard pull protocol, the consumer component (owning the outbound port) has the initiative to call the consumer to get the data. To do so, it calls the method DataRequiredCI.PullCI::request on its outbound port, which in turn calls the same method on the connector, which finally calls the method DataOfferedCI.PullCI::get on the inbound port that must be implemented to call the producer component services to retrieve the data.

    In the standard push protocol, the producer component (owning the inbound port) has the initiative to call the producer to pass it the data. To do so, it calls the method DataOfferedCI.PushCI::send on its inbound port, which in turn calls the same method on the connector, which finally calls the method DataRequiredCI.PushCI::receive on the outbound port that must be implemented to call the consumer component services to pass it the data.

    In the case of the HeaterCyPhy component (the producer) and its HeaterController controller (the consumer), the two standard protocols can be used: in the pull control mode, the controller uses the standard pull protocol to get the target temperature and the current room temperature from the heater, while in the push control mode, the heater uses the standard push protocol to pass the temperatures to the controller, hence triggering the execution of the control per se. The pull control is started by the HeaterCyPhy component by pushing its state sensor value through the standard push protocol when switched on, and its is stopped also by passing its state when switched off. The controller schedules the execution of the control as a repetitive task with a given control period. The push control is also started and stopped when switching on and off the heater, but the repetitive task is scheduled and executed on the heater to push the data towards the controller upon a request made by the controller through by calling the method HeaterSensorCI::startTemperaturesPushSensor.

    As the standard pull and push protocols are used to transmit the state of the heater and the temperatures, the component interface HeaterSensorCI adds method allowing to access other sensor data and also other methods required to implement the cooperation between the two components, like the method HeaterSensorCI::startTemperaturesPushSensor.

    Invariants

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

    Created on : 2023-11-27

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  HeaterSensorDataCI.HeaterSensorCI
      The component interface HeaterSensorCI declares the common services used in pull mode to get the sensor data from the heater.
      static interface  HeaterSensorDataCI.HeaterSensorOfferedPullCI
      The interface HeaterSensorOfferedPullCI is the pull interface that a server component must offer to be called the inbound port.
      static interface  HeaterSensorDataCI.HeaterSensorRequiredPullCI
      The interface HeaterSensorRequiredPullCI is the pull interface that a client component must require to call the outbound port.
